title: Capricious summer = Rozmarne leto [NTSC]
creator_credit: Jiri Menzel, Jan Libora, Filmove Studio Barrandov and Ceskoslovensky Filmexport
brief_description: At a second-rate, turn-of-the-century resort, the pool manager, an ex-mayor, and a priest spend the sleepy summer days swimming, drinking, eating and pontificating on Life in a flowery language — until an aerialist/magician and his beautiful “assistant” come to town. Each of the trio in turn becomes humiliatingly convinced that it is too late for an adventure. Based on a novel by the Czech writer Vladimir Vancura, ‘Capricious Summer’ displays the subtle atmosphere of a Jean Renoir film. A film of the Czech New Wave—an highly fertile period in Czech film history that was brutally repressed by the Soviet invasion in 1968. Cast includes Rudolf Hrusinsky, Vlastimil Brodsky, Frantisek Rehak, Mila Myslikova and Jiri Menzel as the aerialist/magician. (Award: Grand Prix, Karlovy Vary Film Festival)
